recipe_name: Spicy prawn linguine with garlic, tomato and herbs
author: Gino D'Acampo
method: Heat the olive oil in a pan and fry the onion and garlic for 3-4 minutes, or until softened, then add the chilli flakes and prawns. Cook until the prawns have turned pink and are just cooked through.  Add the tomatoes and wine and cook for 2-3 minutes, then stir in the herbs and lemon juice. Add the cooked linguine and stir well to coat.  Pile the linguine onto a serving plate and serve.
ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil,  ½ onion, chopped,  3 garlic cloves, crushed,  1 pinch chilli flakes,  4 tiger prawns ,  6 cherry tomatoes, halved,  50ml/2fl oz white wine,  2 tbsp chopped fresh parsley ,  2 tbsp chopped fresh basil,  ½ lemon, juice only,  150g/5½ oz linguine, cooked according to packet instructions, drained
